LO MEIN

Chinese lo mein is a type of noodles that is popular in Chinese cuisine. It is made from wheat flour and water, and sometimes eggs are added to the dough. The noodles are then boiled and stir-fried with vegetables and meat.

4-6 servings 30 minutes
THIS IS AN ADVERT

Equipment

  • Mixing bowl
  • Rolling pin
  • Knife
  • Pot
  • Wok

Ingredients

  • Wheat flour
  • Water
  • Eggs
  • Vegetables
  • Meat

Directions

  1. Mix the wheat flour and water together to make a dough.
  2. Add eggs to the dough and knead until smooth.
  3. Allow the dough to rest for 30 minutes.
  4. Cut the dough into noodles and boil in water for 3-5 minutes.
  5. Drain the noodles and stir-fry with vegetables and meat.
